properties.areaDesc: Greater Lake Tahoe Area; Greater Lake Tahoe Area
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 11 at 11:48AM PST until January 14 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Reno NV
properties.description:
* WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 6 inches
for Truckee and South Lake Tahoe and Incline Village. Snow
totals 8 to 12 inches for Donner, Echo, and Mt Rose passes.
Winds gusting as high as 60 mph, with gusts over 100 mph on
ridges.

* WHERE...Greater Lake Tahoe Area.

* WHEN...From 7 PM Monday to 10 AM PST Tuesday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions and expect
significant delays driving over Sierra passes. Chain controls
are likely. The hazardous conditions will impact the Monday
evening and Tuesday morning commutes.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Strong winds could cause tree damage and
low visibility situations. Waves on Lake Tahoe are projected to
reach 4 to 6 feet, especially near the east and northeast
shores. Clearly this would be dangerous for boating.
properties.instruction:
Even light snowfall causes major travel delays, especially during
periods of high traffic volume. Be sure to allow extra time to
reach your destination. Leave extra space between vehicles since
it takes longer to stop on slick roadways.

The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM MONDAY TO 10 AM PST TUESDAY
